abstract: Australia’s central bank raised its benchmark interest rate a quarter-point to 6.5 percent, the highest rate in almost 11 years.
snippet: Australia’s central bank raised its benchmark interest rate a quarter-point to 6.5 percent, the highest rate in almost 11 years.
lead_paragraph: Australia’s central bank raised its benchmark interest rate a quarter-point to the highest rate in almost 11 years. The bank raised the overnight cash rate to 6.5 percent, the first adjustment since November, to curb inflation running faster than the bank had forecast and to cool the biggest surge in lending since 1989. The increase might undermine Prime Minister John Howard’s campaign this year to win a fifth term. “This does not help the government in the lead-up to the campaign,” said John Edwards, the chief economist at HSBC Bank Australia in Sydney.

headline.main: Central Bank Raises a Key Interest Rate
headline.print_headline: Central Bank Raises a Key Interest Rate
